net.tinyos.prowler

Class GaussianRadioModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.tinyos.prowler.RadioModel
      • net.tinyos.prowler.GaussianRadioModel

  • public class GaussianRadioModel
extends RadioModel
    This radio model uses the assumption that nodes are mainly static, they don't change their positions to often. So it modulates the ideal radio strength first when the RadioModel.updateNeighborhoods() is called adding a Gaussian noise to it, then it is further modulated on a per-transmission basis again adding a Gaussian noise.
    Author:
    Gabor Pap, Gyorgy Balogh, Miklos Maroti

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  GaussianRadioModel.Neighborhood
      This class stores all the node related data the GaussianRadioModel needs, this includes an array of neighboring notes, the static fading and the dynamic strentgh as well for every neighboring nodes plus the entity being transmitted by the node.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double dynamicRandomFactor
      This coefficient is used to "simulate" the dynamic part of environmental noise.
      double fallingFactorHalf
      The exhibitor of the radio signal degradation, typically it is 2/2 if the motes are well above ground, though at ground level this factor is closer to 3/2.
      double radioStrengthCutoff
      This limits the number of neighbours used to calculate interference ratio.
      double staticRandomFactor
      This coefficient is used to "simulate" the static part of environmental noise.

      A parameterized constructor used to set the simulator at creation time.

    • Field Detail

      • fallingFactorHalf

        public double fallingFactorHalf
        The exhibitor of the radio signal degradation, typically it is 2/2 if the motes are well above ground, though at ground level this factor is closer to 3/2. For efficiency reasons, this number is the half of the usually defined falling factor.

      • staticRandomFactor

        public double staticRandomFactor
        This coefficient is used to "simulate" the static part of environmental noise. It is used when the mote field is first set up.

      • radioStrengthCutoff

        public double radioStrengthCutoff
        This limits the number of neighbours used to calculate interference ratio. Using neighborhood instead of endless radio signals makes the simulation somewhat faster.

      • dynamicRandomFactor

        public double dynamicRandomFactor
        This coefficient is used to "simulate" the dynamic part of environmental noise. The dynamic noise is recalculated for each transmission.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GaussianRadioModel

        public GaussianRadioModel(Simulator sim)
        A parameterized constructor used to set the simulator at creation time.
        Parameters:
        sim - a reference to the simulator

    • Method Detail

      • updateNeighborhoods

        public void updateNeighborhoods()
        (Re)calculates the neighborhoods of every node in the network. This operation should be called whenever the location of the nodes changed. This operation is extremely expensive and should be used sparsely.
        Specified by:
        updateNeighborhoods in class RadioModel
